headline: The Cigna Group Foundation Awards an Additional $3 Million in Local Grants to Support Veterans' Mental Health
summary: The Cigna Group Foundation, the philanthropic arm of The Cigna Group (NYSE: CI), today announced the 2025 grant recipients for its veteran mental health initiative. As part of a three-year, $9 million commitment, this latest round of funding will support 24 local nonprofit organizations in helping veterans feel stable where they live, physically, emotionally and financially.

content.title: The Cigna Group Foundation Awards an Additional $3 Million in Local Grants to Support Veterans' Mental Health
content.summary: The Cigna Group Foundation, the philanthropic arm of The Cigna Group (NYSE: CI), today announced the 2025 grant recipients for its veteran mental health initiative. As part of a three-year, $9 million commitment, this latest round of funding will support 24 local nonprofit organizations in helping veterans feel stable where they live, physically, emotionally and financially.

thumbnail.caption: Employees of The Cigna Group in St. Louis, MO, volunteered with Veterans Community Project earlier this year to help construct tiny homes for a tiny home community, which will house 50 veterans and families upon completion and include an on-site outreach and resource center, green spaces, pet-friendly areas, security, and more. Veterans Community Project is a 2024 grant recipient of The Cigna Group Foundationâ€™s Improving Veteran Mental Health Grant program.
